intro: Gonolobus hirsutissimus, commonly known as the hairy gonolobus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, yellow flowers clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a legume pod that contains several seeds. This species is often found in open woodlands and along forest edges, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
